about_the_game:
Since its debut nearly two decades ago, General Electric’s landmark “Genesis” passenger diesel locomotive has been the Thoroughbred of Amtrak diesel motive power, hauling short- and long-haul Amtrak intercity passenger trains throughout the vast United States.

Now, through the craftsmanship of accomplished developer DTM, the original version of the stylish Genesis diesel – the P40DC (also often called the Dash 8-40BP) comes to Train Simulator Classic along with an all-new complete Amtrak Superliner consist!

The GE P40DC made its debut in 1993, based upon specifications Amtrak had developed two years earlier. The specifications for the locomotive called for a micro-processor-equipped 4,000-horsepower unit with HEP (hotel) power that would be both stylish and trim (to ensure the diesel could operate throughout Amtrak’s entire system). To create the pioneering locomotive, General Electric collaborated with its German subsidiary (which provided high-speed bolsterless two-axle trucks and enlisted its time-proven FDL-series 16-cylinder engine to provide the power. Amtrak designer Cesar Vergara created the distinctive design of the potent locomotive.

In the spring of 1994, 44 Amtrak P40DCs rolled out of GE’s Erie (Pennsylvania) plant wearing Amtrak’s stunning red, blue, and silver Phase III livery. Beginning in 1995, a dual-power sister, the P32AC-DM, was constructed for Amtrak and Metro-North, and in 1996 the first of what would eventually total 228 P42DCs were constructed by GE. Internally, the P42DC called upon an additional 200 horsepower; externally the P42s were virtually identical to the P40DC.

As created for Train Simulator Classic by noted developer DTM, the P40DC is a superb visual recreation of the landmark locomotive and it features authentic controls and performance, including advance air braking operations. The P40DC is provided in both its original Phase III livery and Amtrak’s much-admired Phase IV scheme as debuted in 1993.

As an extraordinary bonus, the Amtrak P40DC DLC for Train Simulator Classic also features a set of Amtrak’s extraordinary bi-level Superliner passenger equipment. Introduced in 1978 and still serving today as the backbone of Amtrak’s long-haul equipment,

the Superliners in this Add-On wears Phase IV liveries, and include Sleeper, Deluxe Sleeper, Transition Sleeper, Coach, Diner, Lounge. Four career scenarios re-creating a journey of the legendary Amtrak Empire Builder on the popular Stevens Pass route through the Cascade Mountains (route available separately) will give you the opportunity to take the throttle of the P40DC for truly memorable railroading!

Included Scenarios


Four career scenarios featuring the P40DC and Superliner-equipped Empire Builder crossing the Cascades on the Train Simulator Classic Stevens Pass route (route available separately).

  • 01-Empire Builder to Chicago Part 1.
  • 02-Empire Builder to Chicago Part 2.
  • 03-Empire Builder to Chicago Part 3.
  • 04-Empire Builder to Chicago Part 4.

More scenarios are available on the Steam Workshop online and in-game. Train Simulator’s Steam Workshop scenarios are free and easy to download, adding many more hours of exciting gameplay. With scenarios being added daily, why don’t you check it out now!

Key Features


  • Amtrak General Electric P40PC “Genesis” 4,000-horsepower diesel locomotive
  • P40DC in Amtrak Phase III and Phase IV liveries
  • Realistic and interactive controls and advanced air braking controls and performance
  • Amtrak Superliner consist in Phase IV livery, including Sleeper, Deluxe Sleeper, Transition Sleeper, Coach, Diner, Lounge
  • Amtrak Heritage baggage car in Phase IV livery
  • Amtrak Express Car in Phase IV livery
  • Four career scenarios featuring the P40DC and Empire Builder on the Stevens Pass route (route available separately)
  • Quick-Drive compatible
  • Download size: 551.7 MB

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum for 32-bit:
  • OS *: 32-bit Windows 7 Service Pack 1, 8.1 or 10 Required (Other OS versions and types are not supported)
  • Processor: Intel Core-i3 4330 3.50 GHz Dual Core or AMD A8 6600K 3.90 GHz Quad Core or Better
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 750 Ti or AMD Radeon R9 Graphics with 1 GB Dedicated VRAM or Better
  • DirectX®: 9.0c
  • Network: Broadband Connection (May incur additional costs for use)
  • Storage: 40 GB or more available space (Additional Add-Ons will require more)
  • Sound Card: DirectX Compatible Audio Device
  • Additional Notes: Requires mouse and keyboard or Xbox Controller
Laptop, Notebook, Mobile or Low Power versions of the above specifications (including Intel or Integrated Graphics) may work but are not supported. Updates to Chipset, Graphics and Audio Device Drivers may be required. For information relating to recommended specifications for Train Simulator 64-bit, please refer to the Train Simulator Classic User Guide.
